comments:
We have a self-defined target platform that contains just org.eclipse.osgi, org.eclipse.core.runtime and org.junit from the Eclipse platform. All other plugins are self-written and build. This platform is defined as target platform in the preferences.

If I start some JUnit tests within my workspace as JUnit Plugin Tests I get an error message telling me that org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime is missing. And I cannot just put this into my self-defined target platform.

Problem appeared in 3.2M5, it worked well with 3.2M4.

right.  we used to look for these two plugins in the host Eclipse if they were not found in the target.  We removed that in 3.2M5 since we no longer support 2.1 targets and we thought the only time a target would be missing pde.junit.runtime is if it were 2.1

We will fix that.  In the meantime, you could import pde.junit.runtime and jdt.junit.runtime into your workspace.
Thanks for fixing this. And thanks for the work-around. Works well.

I am having trouble again in this setting using RC4. See output below. Hope you can help!!! Thanks!!!

(runtime workbench is started with JDK 1.4.2)
